label: germ cell
definition: 1. A gamete (as an egg or sperm cell) or one of its antecedent cells. 2. A mature male or female germ cell usually possessing a haploid chromosome set and capable of initiating formation of a new diploid individual by fusion with a gamete of the opposite sex.

label: penis papilla
definition: A rounded protuberance, connected to the seminal vesicles, responsible for transferring semen into a mating partner's bursal canal.

label: spermatid
definition: A male germ cell that develops from the haploid secondary spermatocytes. Without further division, spermatids undergo structural changes and give rise to spermatozoa.

label: regeneration
definition: The regrowth of a lost or destroyed body part, such as an organ or tissue. This process may occur via renewal, repair, and/or growth alone (i.e. increase in size or mass).

label: bursal canal
definition: The passageway connecting the gonopore to the bursa (genital atrium). Part of the copulatory apparatus. During mating, sperm from a partner is deposited into the bursal canal, where it collects in the bursa before travelling up the oviducts to the bursa.  Egg capsules pass through the bursal canal as they are laid through the gonopore.

label: embryo
definition: Anatomical entity that comprises the organism in the early stages of growth and differentiation that are characterized by cleavage, the laying down of fundamental tissues, and the formation of primitive organs and organ systems. For example, for mammals, the process would begin with zygote formation and end with birth. For insects, the process would begin at zygote formation and end with larval hatching. For plant zygotic embryos, this would be from zygote formation to the end of seed dormancy. For plant vegetative embryos, this would be from the initial determination of the cell or group of cells to form an embryo until the point when the embryo becomes independent of the parent plant.

label: secondary gut branch
definition: Gut branches, originating from and connected to the primary gut branches, that extend laterally towards the body edge.

label: embryonic gut cavity
definition: Lumen of embryonic digestive tract, prior to formation of the branched defintive gut.

label: gametogenesis
definition: The production of haploid germ cells from diploid precursor cells through meiosis.

label: collecting duct
definition: Non-ciliated tubules associated with the distal tubules, which cross the basement membrane and terminate in the dorsal epidermis.

label: anchor cell
definition: Specialized epithelial cell located along the dorsoventral margin that surrounds the viscid and releasing gland cells.

label: proximal tubule epithelial cell
definition: Ciliated epithelial cells that assemble into proximal tubules.

label: intracellular part
definition: Any constituent part of the living contents of a cell; the matter contained within (but not including) the plasma membrane, usually taken to exclude large vacuoles and masses of secretory or ingested material. In eukaryotes it includes the nucleus and cytoplasm.

label: definitive gut
definition: The planarian triclad gut contains a central anterior gut branch connected to two posterior gut branches arranged around the definitive pharynx. Secondary gut branches extend laterally from the primary gut branches, while tertiary gut branches extend from the secondary branches. Food and waste enter and exit the definitive gut through the defintive pharynx.

label: lysosome
definition: The digestive component of the cell. They are homogenous, dense, membrane bound organelles filled with acid hydrolases which break down polymers.

label: posterior primary gut branch
definition: The primary gut branches of the triclad gut lateral and posterior to the pharynx and pharyngeal pouch.

label: Stage 5
definition: D5-D7. Organogenesis onset. Downregulation of early embryo enriched transcripts and birth of adult lineages within the blastomere population. Early embryonic gut formation continues. Yolk ingestion into the gut cavity. Days 5-7 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: bipolar neuron
definition: A type of interneuron that has two neurites, usually an axon and a dendrite, extending from opposite poles of an ovoid cell body.

label: extraembryonic structure
definition: A multicellular anatomical structure that is associated with an embryo and derived from the zygote from which it develops, but which does not contribute to the embryo proper or to structures that are part of the same organism after embryogenesis.

label: pax3/7+ neural progenitor cell
definition: piwi-1+, pax3/7+ progenitor neoblasts implicated in the production of DBH+ ventral midline neurons.

label: organelle
definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function. Includes the nucleus, mitochondria, plastids, vacuoles, vesicles, ribosomes and the cytoskeleton, and prokaryotic structures such as anammoxosomes and pirellulosomes. Excludes the plasma membrane.

label: anterior primary gut branch
definition: The single, central gut branch of the triclad gut anterior to the definitive pharynx.

label: inner pharyngeal epithelium
definition: Heavily ciliated epidermal cells covering the inner surface of the pharynx shaft.

label: microvillus
definition: Thin cylindrical membrane-covered projections on the surface of an animal cell containing a core bundle of actin filaments.

label: biotype
definition: Organisms sharing a specified genotype or karyotype.

label: prepharyngeal region
definition: Region of the juvenile or adult animal between the posterior end of the cephalic ganglia and the anterior end of the definitive pharynx.

label: endoplasmic reticulum
definition: Network of interconnected, flattened, and/or tubular membrane, known as cisternae. This membrane is contiguous with the outer nuclear membrane. The endoplasmic reticulum is involved in both protein and lipid synthesis.

label: central nervous system neuron
definition: Any neuron that is part of a central nervous system.

label: pharyngeal radial muscle fiber
definition: Pharynx muscle fibers that run radially, connecting the outer muscle fibers and epithelia with their inner counterparts.

label: nerve
definition: An enclosed, cable-like bundle of axons in the peripheral nervous system originating in a nerve root in the central nervous system (or a condensed nervous structure) connecting with peripheral structures.

label: temporary embryonic pharynx lumen epithelial surface
definition: The epithelial cell surface lining the temporary embryonic pharynx lumen.

label: serotonergic neural progenitor cell
definition: piwi-1+, lhx1/5-1+, pitx+ progenitor neoblasts required for specification of tph+ serotonergic neurons.

label: membrane
definition: A lipid bilayer along with all the proteins and protein complexes embedded in it an attached to it.

label: nervous system commissure
definition: Axon tract that crosses the midline of the central nervous system[NIF, modified]. In the context of Drosophila refers to a broad band of axons connecting equivalent neuropils each side of the brain[FBbt].

label: pharyngeal pouch surface
definition: The surface of the parapharyngeal pouch facing the pharynx.

label: oviduct epithelium
definition: Ciliated epithelium lining the oviduct.

label: outer pharyngeal epithelium
definition: Heavily ciliated epidermal cells covering the outer surface of the pharynx shaft. These are "insunk" epidermal cells in which the nuclei reside behind the layers of longitudinal and circumferential muscles and the epithelial cell body sends out a ciliated projection to the surface to cover and encase the shaft.

label: epithelial cell component
definition: A part of an epithelial cell.

label: oogonial cell
definition: An undifferentiated germ cell that proliferates rapidly and gives rise to oocytes.

label: male primordial germ cell
definition: Neoblasts coexpressing piwi-1 and nanos that are required for male and female gonad formation. Primordial germ cells are present in both asexual and sexual adults.

label: seminal vesicle
definition: Glandular pouches adjoining the sperm ducts which produce seminal fluid.

label: sperm duct epithelial cell
definition: Ciliated epithelial cells comprising the sperm ducts.

label: yolk cell
definition: An extraembryonic cell, produced by somatic vitellogenic glands in adult hermaphrodites, that provides nutrition to the developing embryo.

label: embryonic gut cell
definition: Dispersed, phagocytic gut cells that appear during Stage 4 and ultimately generate a honeycomb-like lattice surrounding the central gut cavity in Stage 5 embryos. Early embryonic gut cell specific transcripts are expressed from Stage 4-6, and are downregulated during Stage 7.

label: embryonic cell
definition: A cell of the embryo.

label: anatomical compartment subdivision
definition: A subdivision of an anatomical compartment.

label: ventral epidermis
definition: Single cell layer of ventral, post-mitotic, heavily ciliated epithelial cells

label: photoreceptor neuron
definition: Bipolar photoreceptor neurons with dendritic projections into the optic cup and axons that innervate the underlying brain.

label: plasma membrane
definition: The membrane surrounding a cell that separates the cell from its external environment. It consists of a phospholipid bilayer and associated proteins.

label: sympathetic neuron
definition: Sympathetic neurons are part of the sympathetic nervous system and are primarily adrenergic producing the neurotransmitter noradrenalin along with other neuropeptides.

label: optic cup
definition: A portion of the eye containing pigment cells and dendritic projections from photoreceptor neurons.

label: ribosome
definition: An intracellular organelle, about 200 A in diameter, consisting of RNA and protein. It is the site of protein biosynthesis resulting from translation of messenger RNA (mRNA). It consists of two subunits, one large and one small, each containing only protein and RNA. Both the ribosome and its subunits are characterized by their sedimentation coefficients, expressed in Svedberg units (symbol: S). Hence, the prokaryotic ribosome (70S) comprises a large (50S) subunit and a small (30S) subunit, while the eukaryotic ribosome (80S) comprises a large (60S) subunit and a small (40S) subunit. Two sites on the ribosomal large subunit are involved in translation, namely the aminoacyl site (A site) and peptidyl site (P site). Ribosomes from prokaryotes, eukaryotes, mitochondria, and chloroplasts have characteristically distinct ribosomal proteins.

label: dorsal epidermis
definition: Single cell layer of dorsal, post-mitotic, epithelial cells containing the dorsal stripe.

label: TrpA+ neural progenitor cell
definition: piwi-1+, runt-1+, ap2+ progenitor neoblasts required for production of TrpA+ neurons.

label: cytoskeleton organization
definition: A process that is carried out at the cellular level which results in the assembly, arrangement of constituent parts, or disassembly of cytoskeletal structures.

label: epidermal progenitor
definition: Mitotically active zeta neoblasts and their post-mitotic descendants which undergo progressive differentiation and outward directed movement through the mesenchyme prior to incorporation into the epidermis, where terminal differentiation occurs.

label: posterior pole
definition: Distinct posterior cluster of muscle cells located at the midline which express wnt1.

label: sphere formation
definition: Generation of a multilayered spherical embryo comprised of temporary extraembryonic tissues and undifferentiated blastomeres.

label: obsolete anatomical line
definition: OBSOLETE Non-material anatomical entity of one dimension, which forms a boundary of an anatomical surface or is a modulation of an anatomical surface.

label: neural progenitor
definition: Neoblasts and their differentiating daughters implicated in maintenance and regeneration of different tissues in the nervous system.

label: dorsal compartment
definition: Three dimensional compartment along the dorsoventral axis that is above the anteroposterior axis,  containing the eyes.

label: motor neuron
definition: An efferent neuron that passes from the central nervous system or a ganglion toward or to a muscle and conducts an impulse that causes or inhibits movement.

label: pharyngeal epithelium
definition: Epithelia associated with the pharynx organ.

label: intestinal phagocyte
definition: Absorptive digestive cells that engulf food particles for intracellular digestion.

label: gastrodermal plexus
definition: A thin net of single nerve fibers located around the gut.

label: nuclear part
definition: Any constituent part of the nucleus, a membrane-bounded organelle of eukaryotic cells in which chromosomes are housed and replicated.

label: ovarian somatic gonadal cell
definition: ophis+ somatic cells (gh4-, nanos-) in the ovary that may provide trophic support to female germline stem cells and differentiating oogonia.

label: releasing gland cell
definition: Specialized insunk epithelial cell that is part of the adhesion gland which is responsible for production of releasing substance.

label: acidophilic cytoplasm
definition: Cytoplasm that exhibits molecular interaction for acidic dyes under specific pH conditions.

label: obsolete acellular anatomical structure
definition: OBSOLETE Anatomical structure that consists of cell parts and cell substances and together does not constitute a cell or a tissue.

label: secretory system
definition: Anatomical system that has as its parts cells and glands devoted to the discharge of substances such as mucus.

label: lumen of digestive tract
definition: An anatomical space that is surrounded by a digestive tract.

label: cholinergic neuron
definition: Neurons that express choline acetyltransferase.

label: tail
definition: Caudal region, beginning at the mouth and ending at posterior pole.

label: obsolete anatomical entity
definition: OBSOLETE Biological entity that is either an individual member of a biological species or constitutes the structural organization of an individual member of a biological species.

label: obsolete developing anatomical structure
definition: OBSOLETE Anatomical structure that is present during embryonic development.

label: oviparity
definition: A reproductive strategy in which eggs are laid, with most embryonic development occurring outside of the parent.

label: ovary
definition: A gonad containing female germline stem cells which fuel oocyte production. Two ovaries are located ventally, underneath the body wall musculature, immediately posterior to the cephalic ganglia (brain) and adjacent to the ventral nerve cords. The neoblast compartment, including piwi-1+, nanos+ primordial germ cells, fuel formation of the ovaries during juvenile development.

label: terminally differentiated cell
definition: A post-mitotic, terminally differentiated cell type found in planarian embryos, juveniles and/or adult animals.

label: pharyngeal longitudinal muscle fiber
definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running anteroposterior (proximal to distal).

label: spermatogonium
definition: An euploid male germ cell of an early stage of spermatogenesis. In planaria, the gh4+ stem cell daughter exiting the niche undergoes three rounds of transit amplifying division with incomplete cytokinesis prior to transitioning to terminal differentiation.

label: female primordial germ cell
definition: Definition forthcoming

label: anatomical system
definition: Multicellular, connected anatomical structure that has multiple organs as parts and whose parts work together to achieve some shared function.

label: primitive ectoderm
definition: A single cell layer of extraembryonic, post-mitotic ectodermal cells bounding the embryo. The primitive ectoderm forms during Stage 2 and is thought to degenerate as the definitive epidermis forms during Stages 5-7.

label: proximal tubule
definition: Ciliated epithelial cells form tubules, generating coiled, branching units terminating in flame bulbs. Tubules are formed via intercellular junctions between two epithelial cells. Proximal tubules are connected to non-ciliated distal tubules within the parenchyma.

label: Stage 8
definition: D13-D15. Organogenesis and organ maturation continues. Hatching. Days 13-15 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: excitatory motor neuron
definition: A motor neuron that is capable of directly inducing muscle contraction.

label: gastrodermis
definition: The single cell layer columnar epithelial lining of the intestine. The gastrodermis is surrounded by a basal lamina and enteric muscle.

label: fission plane
definition: Transverse anatomical plane, located approximately 1-2 mm from the posterior extremity of an adult animal, at which fission occurs.

label: circular muscle progenitor cell
definition: piwi-1+, nkx1-1+ progenitor neoblasts required for specification of circular muscle fibers.

label: Golgi apparatus
definition: A compound membranous cytoplasmic organelle of eukaryotic cells, consisting of flattened, ribosome-free vesicles arranged in a more or less regular stack. The Golgi apparatus differs from the endoplasmic reticulum in often having slightly thicker membranes, appearing in sections as a characteristic shallow semicircle so that the convex side (cis or entry face) abuts the endoplasmic reticulum, secretory vesicles emerging from the concave side (trans or exit face). In vertebrate cells there is usually one such organelle, while in invertebrates and plants, where they are known usually as dictyosomes, there may be several scattered in the cytoplasm. The Golgi apparatus processes proteins produced on the ribosomes of the rough endoplasmic reticulum; such processing includes modification of the core oligosaccharides of glycoproteins, and the sorting and packaging of proteins for transport to a variety of cellular locations. Three different regions of the Golgi are now recognized both in terms of structure and function: cis, in the vicinity of the cis face, trans, in the vicinity of the trans face, and medial, lying between the cis and trans regions.

label: circular muscle fiber
definition: Body wall muscle fibers arrayed around the dorsoventral axis. Upon regeneration, these are thought to be produced de novo in the blastema.

label: brain
definition: The brain is the center of the nervous system in all vertebrate, and most invertebrate, animals. Some primitive animals such as jellyfish and starfish have a decentralized nervous system without a brain, while sponges lack any nervous system at all. In vertebrates, the brain is located in the head, protected by the skull and close to the primary sensory apparatus of vision, hearing, balance, taste, and smell.

label: cell-cell junction
definition: A cell junction that forms a connection between two or more cells in a multicellular organism; excludes direct cytoplasmic junctions such as ring canals.

label: Smed asexual biotype
definition: Obligate asexual animals that reproduce solely through fission followed by whole body regeneration. Asexual Smed are stable diploids that harbor a chromosome translocation, making them karyotypically distinct from sexual Smed.

label: nuclear pore
definition: Any of the numerous similar discrete openings in the nuclear envelope of a eukaryotic cell, where the inner and outer nuclear membranes are joined.

label: autonomic neuron
definition: A neruon whose cell body is within an autonomic ganglion.

label: racing stripe
definition: Ciliated epidermal cells located along the dorsal midline.

label: Stage 3
definition: D2-D4. Dispersed blastomere cleavage in the embryonic wall of nascent spheres. Yolk ingestion into the gut cavity. Days 2-4 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: temporary embryonic pharynx neuron
definition: A neuronal cell innervating the temporary embryonic pharynx. Four neurons innervate the radial muscle fibers that ring the oral opening.

label: enteric musculature
definition: Visceral muscle surrounding the definitive gut.

label: optic chiasma
definition: A decussation of the diencephalon where the fibers of the optic nerve cross

label: lateral nerve
definition: A nerve extending laterally from the ventral nerve cord that innervates the submuscular plexus.

label: plasma membrane part
definition: Any constituent part of the plasma membrane, the membrane surrounding a cell that separates the cell from its external environment. It consists of a phospholipid bilayer and associated proteins.

label: Schmidtea mediterranea developmental stage
definition: A stage of embryonic development defined by a unique gene expression signature, morphology and chronological time post-egg capsule deposition for hermaphrodites reared at 20ËšC.

label: actin-based cell projection
definition: A cell projection supported by an assembly of actin filaments.

label: obsolete anatomical boundary
definition: OBSOLETE A non-material anatomical entity of two dimensions. Anatomical boundaries are contiguous structures.

label: definitive organism subdivision
definition: Anatomical structure which is a subdivision of a whole adult or juvenile organism, consisting of components of multiple anatomical systems.

label: extracellular organelle
definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, occurring outside the cell. Includes, for example, extracellular membrane vesicles (EMVs) and the cellulosomes of anaerobic bacteria and fungi.

label: multipolar neuron
definition: Neuron with an axon and two or more dendrites.

label: inner pharyngeal longitudinal muscle fiber
definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running anteroposterior which lie beneath both the inner circular muscle fibers and the apical, ciliated portion of the epithium lining the lumenal surface.

label: embryonic gut cell surface
definition: The surface of phagocytic embryonic gut cells in contact with ingested yolk cells.

label: cellular component
definition: The part of a cell, extracellular environment or virus in which a gene product is located. A gene product may be located in one or more parts of a cell and its location may be as specific as a particular macromolecular complex, that is, a stable, persistent association of macromolecules that function together. Source: NIF_Subcellular:sao-1337158144, GOC:go_curators

label: plane of autotomy
definition: An anatomical plane that bisects a zone of weakness in an appendage. When autotomy occurs, the appendage divides along this plane.

label: pharynx lumen epithelial surface
definition: The epithelial surface lining the interior of the pharynx, facing the lumen.

label: oviduct lumen
definition: Anatomical space enclosed by the oviduct epithelium.

label: neuropil
definition: A cluster of neurites that is part of a nervous system and forms a network of dendrites and axons where synapses are present and in which neuronal somata do not occur.

label: round spermatid
definition: A cyst of 8 interconnected spermatocytes undergoes meiosis, producing 32 haploid round spermatids. Round spermatids express protein kinase A, and  undergo morphogenesis to produce mature sperm.

label: egg capsule
definition: A proteinaceous, semi-permeable shell housing yolk cells and one or more embryos.  Egg capsules are anchored to a substrate via a stalk.

label: copulatory apparatus
definition: Accessory reproductive structures involved in copulation, egg capsule development and laying.

label: primitive ectoderm cell
definition: Primitive ectoderm cells differentiate from the blastomere population, exit the cell cycle and interact to boud the embryo during Stage 2.

label: reproductive system
definition: Anatomical system that has as its parts the organs concerned with reproduction.

label: neuron
definition: The basic cellular unit of nervous tissue. Each neuron consists of a body, an axon, and dendrites. Their purpose is to receive, conduct, and transmit impulses in the nervous system.

label: secretory cell
definition: A cell that specializes in controlled release of one or more substances.

label: outer longitudinal muscle fiber
definition: Outer most body wall muscle fibers arrayed along the anteroposterior axis. These fibers are thinner than the inner longitudinal muscle fibers.

label: embryonic cleavage
definition: The first few specialized divisions of an activated animal egg.

label: body wall musculature compartment
definition: An anatomical compartment of the deep-superficial axis containing the body wall musculature and underlying submuscular nerve plexus.

label: stem cell
definition: A relatively undifferentiated cell that retains the ability to divide and proliferate throughout life to provide progenitor cells that can differentiate into specialized cells.

label: intracellular non-membrane-bounded organelle
definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, not bounded by a lipid bilayer membrane and occurring within the cell. Includes ribosomes, the cytoskeleton and chromosomes

label: eye
definition: An organ that detects light.

label: glial cell
definition: A non-neuronal cell of the nervous system. They not only provide physical support, but also respond to injury, regulate the ionic and chemical composition of the extracellular milieu, guide neuronal migration during development, and exchange metabolites with neurons.

label: epithelial cell
definition: A cell that is usually found in a two-dimensional sheet with a free surface. The cell has a cytoskeleton that allows for tight cell to cell contact and for cell polarity where the apical part is directed towards the lumen and the basal part to the basal lamina.

label: tissue morphogenesis
definition: The process in which the anatomical structures of a tissue are generated and organized.

label: non ciliated epithelial cell
definition: An epithelial cell lacking cilia.

label: posterior compartment
definition: Three dimensional compartment along the anteroposterior axis that is closer to the tail rather than the head, from the anterior boundary of the pharyngeal pouch to the tip of the tail.

label: neurosecretory neuron
definition: Neuronal cells which synthesize, store and release neurohormones.

label: heterochromatin
definition: A compact and highly condensed form of chromatin.

label: dispersed cleavage
definition: A derived form of early embryonic cleavage present in ectolecithal embryos. Blastomeres divide asynchronously within a yolk syncytium, and division progeny do not remain in direct contact with one another.

label: cintillo+ sensory neuron
definition: A subset of sensory neurons located along the dorsal head margin.

label: cytoplasmic vesicle part
definition: Any constituent part of cytoplasmic vesicle, a vesicle formed of membrane or protein, found in the cytoplasm of a cell.

label: pigment cup cell
definition: Non-neuronal, pigmented cells arrayed along the proximal side of the optic cup.

label: neoblast compartment
definition: A heterogeneous population of pluripotent, somatic adult stem cells and lineage primed progenitors that are required for maintenance and regeneration of all cell types in planaria, including the germline.

label: acidophilic gland cell
definition: One of two distinct histochemical classes of gland cells, these can be found throughout the body but primarily form clusters of subepidermal marginal adhesive glands along the dorsalventral border of the animal.

label: coronal plane
definition: Anatomial plane which divides the body into ventral and dorsal regions. This plane always includes the midline and is also known as the frontal plane.

label: subepidermal nerve plexus
definition: Plexus of nerves located just between the definitive epidermis and the body wall musculature.

label: gastrovascular compartment
definition: The innermost anatomical compartment of the deep-superficial axis, extending from the definitive gut lumen to the gastrodermal nerve plexus.

label: secretory vesicle
definition: A cytoplasmic, membrane bound vesicle that is capable of fusing to the plasma membrane to release its contents into the extracellular space.

label: obsolete material anatomical entity
definition: OBSOLETE Anatomical entity that has mass.

label: dopaminergic neuron
definition: A neuron that expresses the neurotransmitter dopamine.

label: obsolete anatomical space
definition: OBSOLETE Non-material anatomical entity of three dimensions, that is generated by morphogenetic or other physiologic processes; is surrounded by one or more anatomical structures; contains one or more organism substances or anatomical structures.

label: temporary embryonic pharynx epithelial cell
definition: foxA1+ epithelial cell contained in the temporary embryonic pharynx.

label: lateral branches
definition: Nerve branches that extend from the lateral side of each cephalic ganglia lobe. Each lobe has nine lateral branches which terminate in sensory organs. Evidence suggests they play a role in chemosensation.

label: male germ cell
definition: A male germ cell is a germ cell that supports male gamete production.

label: sperm duct
definition: A network of tubes that transport sperm from the testes to the seminal vesicles. Tubes connect each testis to ducts that run along the ventral nerve cords. The ducts bifurcate immediately posterior to the pharynx, where they connect to the seminal vesicles.

label: female germline stem cell
definition: A piwi-1+, nanos+ cell residing in the ovary that self-renews and give rise to oogonial cells that differentiate into oocytes.

label: hyman vesicle
definition: PROG-2-5 positive granules that range in size from 0.5um to 1um present in epithelia and epithelia progenitor cells. These are distinct from rhabdites.

label: embryonic structure
definition: Anatomical structure that is part of an embryo.

label: inner longitudinal muscle fiber
definition: Inner most body wall muscle fibers arrayed along the anteroposterior axis. These fibers are thicker than the outer longitudinal muscle fibers. The pattern of these muscles differs along the dorsoventral axis, with the dorsal arrangement converging at the central zone of the anterior pole. The ventral arrangement is more parallel or may diverge slightly as it approaches the ventral pole.

label: mechanoreceptor cell
definition: A cell specialized to transduce mechanical stimuli and relay that information centrally in the nervous system.

label: diagonal muscle fiber
definition: Body wall muscle fibers arrayed diagonally along the anteroposterior axis.

label: Schmidtea mediterranea developmental term
definition: A term used to describe a developmental process during Schmidtea mediterranea embryogenesis.

label: Smed sexual biotype
definition: Cross-fertilizing hemaphrodites that reproduce sexually and do not undergo fission. After mating, each parent lays an egg capsule containing one or more embryos. Sexual Smed are stable diploids.

label: primitive gut cell
definition: Four large phagocytic cells associated with the temporary embryonic pharynx.

label: Stage 6
definition: D7-D9. Organogenesis and morphogenesis. Definitive organ formation. Temporary embryonic cell types degenerate. Embryo elongation. Days 7-9 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: commissural neuron
definition: A neuron that has an axon which crosses the midline.

label: flame bulb
definition: Terminal structure of protonephridia unit; consists of flame cells.

label: temporary embryonic pharynx cavity
definition: Anatomical space enclosed by the temporary embryonic pharynx epithelial cells. Lumen through which yolk cells are transported into the embryonic gut cavity.

label: membrane-bounded organelle
definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, bounded by a single or double lipid bilayer membrane. Includes the nucleus, mitochondria, plastids, vacuoles, and vesicles. Excludes the plasma membrane.

label: dorsoventral margin
definition: Region along the edge of the animal where the dorsal and ventral surfaces meet.

label: pharyngeal circular muscle fiber
definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running parallel to the diameter of the pharynx.

label: cell-cell contact zone
definition: Extended zone of intimate apposition between two cells containing one or more types of intercellular junctions.

label: cell
definition: A material entity of anatomical origin (part of or deriving from an organism) that has as its parts a maximally connected cell compartment surrounded by a plasma membrane.

label: Category 5 cell
definition: Post-mitotic, ciliated epidermal cells.

label: rough endoplasmic reticulum
definition: Endoplasmic reticululum that is studded with ribosomes, leading to a "rough" or "granular" appearance.

label: peripheral nervous system
definition: A major division of the nervous system that contains nerves which connect the central nervous system (CNS) with sensory organs, other organs, muscles, blood vessels and glands.

label: musculature of pharynx
definition: The total musculature within the pharynx.

label: Stage 1
definition: D0-D2. Zygote and dispersed blastomere cleavage in a yolk syncytium. Days 0-2 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: blastomere
definition: An undifferentiated, cycling embryonic cell in Stage 1-5 embryos that expresses piwi-1, numerous adult asexual neoblast enriched genes, and early embryo enriched genes.

label: klf+ sensory neuron progenitor cell
definition: piwi-1+, klf+ progenitor neoblasts required for production of cintillo+ sensory neurons.

label: bounding membrane of organelle
definition: Examples include the outer membranes of double membrane bound organelles such as mitochondria as well as the bounding membranes of single-membrane bound organelles such as lysosomes.

label: cell part
definition: Anatomical structure that is a direct part of the cell.

label: brain commissure
definition: any of the nerve fiber tracts that span the longitudinal fissure between the cerebral and/or cerebellar hemispheres of the brain

label: sperm duct epithelium
definition: Ciliated epithelium lining the sperm duct.

label: outer pharyngeal circular muscle fiber
definition: Pharynx muscle fibers thar run circumferentially about the pharynx and lie just beneath the outer longitudinal pharynx muscles.

label: primitive ectoderm surface
definition: The apical surface of the single layered primitive ectoderm that is in contact with the environment.

label: organ
definition: Anatomical structure that performs a specific function or group of functions.

label: male germline stem cell
definition: gh4+, nanos+ cells residing at the testis periphery that self-renew and give rise to differentiating daughters that will ultimately produce haploid sperm.

label: juvenile
definition: A sexually immature member of the Schmidtea mediterranea sexuallly reproducing biotype.

label: obsolete anatomical structure
definition: OBSOLETE Material anatomical entity that is a single connected structure with inherent 3D shape generated by coordinated expression of the organism's own genome.

label: tuba
definition: A sperm storage organ located immediately posterior to the ovary, at the anterior end of the oviduct. Oocytes exiting the ovary are fertilized in the tuba as they enter the oviduct.

label: visual system
definition: The sensory system subserving the sense of vision.

label: gamma neoblast
definition: An abundant neoblast subclass, exhibiting enriched expression of gata456a, hnf4, prox-1 and nkx2.2, implicated in maintenance and regeneration of the definitive gut.

label: central nervous system
definition: The central nervous system is the core nervous system that serves an integrating and coordinating function. In vertebrates it consists of the neural tube derivatives: the brain and spinal cord. In invertebrates it includes central ganglia plus nerve cord.

label: ventral nerve cord
definition: The pair of closely united ventral longitudinal nerves with their segmental ganglia that is characteristic of many elongate invertebrates (as earthworms)[BTO]. A large process bundle that runs along the vental mid-line extending from the ventral region of the nerve ring[WB]. The ventral cord is one of the distinguishing traits of the central nervous system of all arthropods (such as insects, crustaceans and arachnids) as well as many other invertebrates, such as the annelid worms[GO].

label: Category 4 cell
definition: Post-mitotic, mesenchymally and epidermally located progenitors downstream of the Category 3 cells.

label: unipolar neuron
definition: Neuron with one neurite that extends from the cell body.

label: oral hemisphere
definition: Stage 3-5 embryo hemisphere centered around the temporary embryonic pharynx.

label: axon tract
definition: A group of axons linking two or more neuropils and having a common origin, termination

label: dorsal stripe
definition: Ciliated epithelial cells along the dorsal midline.

label: anterior pole progenitor cell
definition: piwi-1+, foxD+, prep+ progenitor neoblasts required for formation of the anterior pole.

label: definitive epidermis
definition: A single cell layer of post-mitotic epithelial cells containing ciliated and non-ciliated cell types forming the exterior surface of the animal.

label: syncytial yolk cell
definition: Fused yolk cells surrounding blastomeres undergoing dispersed cleavage during Stages 1 and 2.

label: visceral musculature
definition: Musculature surrounding internal organs of the body.

label: ventral compartment
definition: Compartment along the dorsoventral axis that is below the anteroposterior axis.

label: integumental system
definition: Connected anatomical system that forms a barrier between an animal and its environment. In vertebrates, the integumental system consists of the epidermis, dermis plus associated glands and adnexa such as hair and scales. In invertebrates, the integumental system may include cuticle.

label: longitudinal muscle fiber
definition: Body wall muscle fibers arrayed along the anteroposterior axis. Upon regeneration, these muscles are thought to be established from truncated pre-existing fibers.

label: nucleolus
definition: A small, dense body one or more of which are present in the nucleus of eukaryotic cells. It is rich in RNA and protein, is not bounded by a limiting membrane, and is not seen during mitosis. Its prime function is the transcription of the nucleolar DNA into 45S ribosomal-precursor RNA, the processing of this RNA into 5.8S, 18S, and 28S components of ribosomal RNA, and the association of these components with 5S RNA and proteins synthesized outside the nucleolus. This association results in the formation of ribonucleoprotein precursors; these pass into the cytoplasm and mature into the 40S and 60S subunits of the ribosome.

label: basophilic cytoplasm
definition: Cytoplasm that exhibits molecular interaction for basic dyes under specific pH conditions.

label: multicellular anatomical structure
definition: An anatomical structure that has more than one cell as a part.

label: gland cell
definition: Specialized insunk epithelial cells located in the mesenchyme that participate in mucus secretion. They are characterized by elongated cell bodies with long cytoplasmic projections that terminate between, or penetrate directly through  epithelial cells and form a secretory pore at the surface.

label: oral opening
definition: The orifice that connects the mouth to the exterior of the body.

label: temporary embryonic pharynx circular muscle fiber
definition: Differentiated muscle cell present in a circular muscle fiber of the temporary embryonic pharynx.

label: GABAergic neuron
definition: Neurons that express glutamine decarboxylase.

label: sexually mature adult
definition: A fully formed, sexually mature organism. The sexually reproducing Schmidtea mediterranea biotype exists as an obligate cross-fertilizing hermaphrodite.

label: tail stripe
definition: Medial region of the tail; the parenchymal space between the posterior primary gut branches.

label: outer pharynx nerve plexus
definition: Ring of the pharynx nerve plexus that is proximal to the exterior surface.

label: obsolete immaterial anatomical entity
definition: OBSOLETE Anatomical entity that has no mass.

label: cross-fertilization
definition: Fertilization of an oocyte by sperm from a different individual. Reciprocal exchange of sperm occurs during Schmidtea mediterranea copulation.

label: oviduct
definition: Ciliated tubes adjacent to the ventral nerve cords, adjoining the tuba and the bursal canal, that transport fertilized oocytes to the genital atrium.

label: obsolete anatomical cavity
definition: OBSOLETE Anatomical space which contains portions of one or more body substances and is bounded by the internal surface of one maximally connected anatomical structure. Examples: cranial cavity, pharyngeal recess space, nasal cavity, tooth socket, cavity of serous sac, lumen of stomach, lumen of artery, fornix of vagina.

label: spermatocyte
definition: A tektin-1+ male germ cell that develops from spermatogonia. The euploid primary spermatocytes undergo meiosis and give rise to the haploid secondary spermatocytes which in turn give rise to spermatids.

label: whole organism
definition: Anatomical structure that is an individual member of of Schmidtea mediterranea or any other flatworm of the class Turbellaria.

label: distal tubule epithelial cell
definition: Nonciliated epithelial cells that assemble into protonephridial proximal tubules.

label: renal system
definition: The renal system is an anatomical system that maintains fluid balance and contributes to electrolyte balance, acid/base balance, and disposal of nitrogenous waste products.

label: sigma neoblast
definition: A heterogeneous subpopulation of neoblasts with enriched expression of SoxP-1 and SoxP-2 thought to contain both pluripotent stem cells and tissue-specific progenitors.

label: goblet cell
definition: Secretory cells that release digestive enzymes into the lumen of the intestine.

label: ovary nerve plexus
definition: Nerve plexus surrounding the ovary.

label: primordium
definition: Primordia are populations of contiguous cells that are morphologically distinct and already correspond in extent to a later organ/tissue.

label: nucleus
definition: A membrane-bounded organelle of eukaryotic cells in which chromosomes are housed and replicated. In most cells, the nucleus contains all of the cell's chromosomes except the organellar chromosomes, and is the site of RNA synthesis and processing. In some species, or in specialized cell types, RNA metabolism or DNA replication may be absent.

label: clonogenic neoblast
definition: Pluripotent piwi-1+ stem cells that self-renew, form expanding colonies and produce differentiating daughters that contribute to multiple organ systems. cNeoblasts are predicted to be broadly distributed across the anteroposterior axis of the adult worm.

label: adhesion gland
definition: Specialized epithelial cells located along the dorsoventral margin. Adhesion glands are comprised of three cell types, the viscid and releasing gland cells which penetrate through an epithelial anchor cell and terminate at the epithelial surface.

label: definitive pharynx progenitor
definition: foxA1+ neoblasts and their post-mitotic, differentiating daughters required for maintenance and regeneration of the definitive pharynx.

label: cell-cell adhesion
definition: The attachment of one cell to another cell via adhesion molecules.

label: nervous system
definition: The nervous system is an organ system containing predominantly neuron and glial cells. In bilaterally symmetrical organisms, it is arranged in a network of tree-like structures connected to a central body. The main functions of the nervous system are to regulate and control body functions, and to receive sensory input, process this information, and generate behavior [CUMBO].

label: enteric neuron
definition: Neuron that is part of the enteric nervous system.

label: Stage 4
definition: D3-D5. Dispersed blastomere cleavage in the embryonic wall. Yolk ingestion into the gut cavity. Early embryonic gut formation. Days 3-5 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: afferent neuron
definition: A neuron which conveys sensory information centrally from the periphery.

label: esophagus
definition: Attachment between the triclad gut and the proximal end of the definitive pharynx.

label: parenchymal compartment
definition: An anatomical compartment of the deep-superficial axis between the gastrodermal nerve plexus and submuscular nerve plexus.

label: organelle membrane
definition: A membrane that is one of the two lipid bilayers of an organelle envelope or the outermost membrane of single membrane bound organelle.

label: aboral hemisphere
definition: Stage 3-5 embryo hemisphere centered around the pole opposite the temporary embryonic pharynx.

label: cilium
definition: A specialized eukaryotic organelle that consists of a filiform extrusion of the cell surface and of some cytoplasmic parts. Each cilium is largely bounded by an extrusion of the cytoplasmic (plasma) membrane, and contains a regular longitudinal array of microtubules, anchored to a basal body.

label: obsolete anatomical junction
definition: OBSOLETE An anatomical structure that connects two structures

label: protonephridia
definition: Excretory organs consisting of flame cells, proximal tubules, and distal tubules connected to a mesenchymal collecting duct.

label: head
definition: The head is the anterior-most division of the body [GO]. A three dimensional compartment bounded by the anterior margin or the head and the posterior boundary of the cephalic ganglia (brain).

label: mitochondrion
definition: A spherical to rod shaped organelle that generates the majority of a cell's supply of ATP via cellular respiration. Mitochondria have their own genome and consist of outer and inner membranes, the latter folds inward to form cristae. This folding increases the surface area of the membrane and thus increases the space available to produce ATP. The inner and outer membranes are separated by an intermembrane space, and the inner membrane encloses the matrix.

label: neuron associated cell (sensu Nematoda and Protostomia)
definition: Cells that are in close proximity to neurons.

label: outer pharyngeal longitudinal muscle fiber
definition: Pharynx muscle fibers running anteroposterior which lie just underneath the apical, cilaited portion of the outer epithelium.

label: electrically signaling cell
definition: A cell that initiates an electrical signal and passes that signal to another cell.

label: nerve plexus
definition: Anatomical junction where subdivisions of two or more neural trees interconnect with one another to form a network through which nerve fibers of the constituent nerve trees become regrouped; together with other nerve plexuses, nerves and ganglia, it constitutes the peripheral nervous system. Examples: cervical nerve plexus, brachial nerve plexus, sacral nerve plexus[FMA].

label: pharynx outer epithelial surface
definition: Epithelial surface covering the outside of the pharynx.

label: sperm duct lumen
definition: Anatomical space enclosed by the sperm duct epithelium.

label: elongate spermatid
definition: Spermatids expressing protein kinase A undergoing morphogenic changes to make mature sperm.

label: gonad
definition: Reproductive organ that produces and releases eggs (ovary) or sperm (testis).

label: copulatory bursa
definition:
A chamber where egg capsules are formed. One or more zygotes and yolk cells produced by the vitelline glands collect in the copulatory bursa; glands surrounding the copulatory bursa produce the egg capsule shell.
  Nascent egg capsules exit the body by passing through the bursal canal and gonopore. The copulatory bursa is synonymous with the term genital atrium.

label: blastomere compartment
definition: Undifferentiated, zygote-derived cleavage progeny that give rise to temporary embryonic tissues during Stage 2, continue dividing asynchronously in the embryonic wall, and ultimately give rise to neoblasts and adult lineage progenitors beginning in Stage 5.

label: oviduct epithelial cell
definition: Ciliated epithelial cells that assemble into the oviduct.

label: ciliated epithelial cell
definition: An epithelial cell that has cilia.

label: parenchymal musculature
definition: Dorsal-ventral muscle fibers present through the mesenchyme.

label: embryonic digestive system
definition: A cryptic digestive system in Stage 3-6 embryos comprised of temporary embryonic cell types and organs, including the temporary embryonic pharynx and primitive gut cells. Embryonic gut cells, likely produced from blastomeres, form a phagocytic tissue layer surrounding the inner gut cavity during Stages 4-6. It is not known whether the embryonic gut is temporary embryonic tissue or a definitive tissue. For convenience, the embryonic gut is currently designated as an extraembryonic structure because cell type specific markers for the embryonic gut do not stain the definitive gut in hatchlings or adult animals.

label: gamete
definition: A mature sexual reproductive cell having a single set of unpaired chromosomes.

label: definitive tissue
definition: Adult tissues built during organogenesis that are present in juveniles at birth.

label: ganglion
definition: A biological tissue mass of nerve cell bodies.

label: muscle cell
definition: A mature contractile cell, commonly known as a myocyte. This cell has as part of its cytoplasm myofibrils organized in various patterns.

label: trail cell
definition: Ovo+ neoblasts and post-mitotic eye progenitors that simultaneously migrate and differentiate into photoreceptor neurons and non-neuronal pigment cup cells comprising the optic cup.

label: definitive pharynx
definition: A plicate and protrusible organ that is the sole point of entry and exit for the Triclad gut. It contains epithelial, muscular, secretory and neuronal cell types.

label: extracellular component
definition: Anatomical structures that exist outside of cells; non-cellular.

label: oocyte
definition: A female germ cell that has entered meiosis.

label: euchromatin
definition: A dispersed and relatively uncompacted form of chromatin.

label: distal tubule
definition: Sinusoidal, non-ciliated tubules connected to proximal tubules within the parenchyma. Tubules are formed via intercellular junctions between two epithelial cells.

label: epidermal compartment
definition: The outermost region of the deep-superficial axis. This anatomical compartment contains definitive epidermis, basal lamina and subepidermal nerve plexus.

label: vacuole
definition: A closed structure, found only in eukaryotic cells, that is completely surrounded by unit membrane and contains liquid material. Cells contain one or several vacuoles, that may have different functions from each other. Vacuoles have a diverse array of functions. They can act as a storage organelle for nutrients or waste products, as a degradative compartment, as a cost-effective way of increasing cell size, and as a homeostatic regulator controlling both turgor pressure and pH of the cytosol.

label: anterior pole
definition: Distinct anterior cluster of muscle cells located at the midline which express notum, follistatin, zic-1, and foxD.

label: sperm
definition: A mature male germ cell that develops from a spermatid.

label: basophilic gland cell
definition: One of two distinct histochemical classes of gland cells, these are found near the ventral mesenchyme, the pharynx and in the dorsal region of the head. May also be called cyanophilic gland cells.

label: protonephridial progenitor
definition: Neoblasts and post-mitotic, differentiating daughters coexpressing POU2-3, six1/2-2, Sal1, Eya and Osr,  required for maintenance and regeneration of protonephridial cell types.

label: copulatory region
definition: Portion of the sexual biotype body plan immediately posterior to the parapharyngeal region, and immediately anterior to the tail. Encompasses the copulatory apparatus.

label: sensory neuron
definition: Any neuron having a sensory function; an afferent neuron conveying sensory impulses.

label: submuscular nerve plexus
definition: Plexus of nerves that innervate the body wall muscles.

label: testis somatic gonadal cell
definition: dmd-1+ expressing somatic cells within the testis that promote male GSC maintenance. dmd-1+, ophis-1+ somatic gonadal cells ensheath germ cells via long cytoplasmic processes and promote differentiation.

label: non-membrane-bounded organelle
definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, not bounded by a lipid bilayer membrane. Includes ribosomes, the cytoskeleton and chromosomes.

label: viscid gland cell
definition: A specialized insunk epithelial cell that is part of the adhesion glands which is responsible for production and excretion of the viscid substance allowing adherence to a substrate.

label: cytoplasm
definition: All of the contents of a cell excluding the plasma membrane and nucleus, but including other subcellular structures

label: definitive anatomical structure
definition: Anatomical structure present in juvenile and adult planaria.

label: octopaminergic neuron
definition: Neurons that express the biogenic amine octopamine.

label: basal lamina of epithelium
definition: Acellular anatomical structure that consists of a thin sheet of fibrous proteins that underlie and support the cells of an epithelium. It separates the cells of an epithelium from any underlying tissue.

label: cavity of pharynx
definition: A anatomical space that is enclosed by a pharynx.

label: sensory cell
definition: A cell that performs a sensory function.

label: parapharyngeal region
definition: Region of the animal lateral to and surrounding the definitive pharynx.

label: female germ cell
definition: Female germ cell is a germ cell that supports female gamete production.

label: testis
definition: A gonad containing male germline stem cells which fuel sperm production. Testes are located dorsolaterally, and are excluded from the head. The neoblast compartment, including piwi-1+, nanos+ primordial germ cells, fuels formation of testes during juvenile development and regeneration.

label: cement gland
definition: Glands surrounding the copulatory bursa that are required for production of the proteinaceous egg capsule shell and stalk.

label: gonopore
definition: The gonopore, a component of the copulatory apparatus, is an opening located on the ventral side of the animal posterior to the definitive pharynx. The gonopore is the sole point of exit and entry for the reproductive system, allowing from reciprocal exchange of sperm during copulation and egg capsule laying.

label: collecting duct epithelial cell
definition: Nonciliated epithelial cells that assemble into collecting ducts.

label: body wall musculature
definition: Any collection of muscles that is part of a body wall [Automatically generated definition].

label: longitudinal muscle progenitor cell
definition: piwi-1+, myoD+, snail-1+ progenitor neoblasts required for specification and creation of longitudinal muscle fibers.

label: digestive system
definition: Anatomical system that has as its parts the organs devoted to the ingestion, digestion, and assimilation of food and the discharge of residual wastes.

label: tissue
definition: Multicellular anatomical structure that consists of many cells of one or a few types, arranged in an extracellular matrix such that their long-range organisation is at least partly a repetition of their short-range organisation.

label: Category 2 cell
definition: Post-mitotic, mesenchymally located epidermal progenitors downstream of the zeta neoblasts.

label: protosphere
definition: Stage 2 embryo undergoing the process of sphere formation.

label: Stage 7
definition: D9-D11. Organogenesis and organ maturation continues. Embryos elongated. Eyes just visible. Onset of gliding motility. Days 9-11 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: efferent neuron
definition: A neuron which sends impulses peripherally to activate muscles or secretory cells.

label: flame cell
definition: Terminal structure of the protonephridia unit, capping the proximal tubules. Flame cells are defined by the â€˜filtration weirâ€™, which consists of closely apposed strands of cytoplasm surrounding a central cilia bundle, and by numerous microvilli between weir and cilia. Positive for acetyated tubulin.

label: testis nerve plexus
definition: Nerve plexus surrounding the testis.

label: intracellular membrane-bounded organelle
definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, bounded by a single or double lipid bilayer membrane and occurring within the cell. Includes the nucleus, mitochondria, plastids, vacuoles, and vesicles. Excludes the plasma membrane.

label: cephalic ganglia
definition: The planarian brain, consisting of two bilaterally symmetric lobes occupying a ventral position in the head.

label: specific_to
definition: feature restricted to

label: cell junction
definition: A cellular component that forms a specialized region of connection between two or more cells or between a cell and the extracellular matrix. At a cell junction, anchoring proteins extend through the plasma membrane to link cytoskeletal proteins in one cell to cytoskeletal proteins in neighboring cells or to proteins in the extracellular matrix.

label: temporary embryonic pharynx
definition: An innervated, muscular pump that ingests yolk cells into the gut cavity. The temporary embryonic pharynx is an extraembryonic tissue that forms during Stage 2, functions during Stages 3-5, and degenerates during Stages 6-7.

label: smooth endoplasmic reticulum
definition: Endoplamic reticulum that does not contain ribosomes, which synthesizes lipids, phospholipids, and steroids.

label: peripheral nervous system neuron
definition: Any neuron that is part of a peripheral nervous system.

label: pharyngeal pouch
definition: An epithelial structure housing the definitive pharynx, connected to the esophagus and mouth.

label: inner pharynx nerve plexus
definition: Ring of the pharynx nerve plexus that is proximal to the lumen.

label: Stage 2
definition: D2-D3. Sphere formation. A fraction of the blastomeres differentiate into temporary embryonic tissues that provide form and function to the embryo. Undifferentiated blastomeres remain in the embryonic wall. Days 2-3 post-egg capsule deposition at 20ËšC.

label: neuron projection bundle
definition: A fasciculated bundle of neuron projections (GO:0043005), largely or completely lacking synapses.

label: extraembryonic cell
definition: Post-mitotic, terminally differentiated cells which, give rise to temporary embryonic tissues.

label: embryonic wall
definition: The parenchymal space between the gut cavity and the primitive ectoderm containing undifferentiated blastomeres in Stage 3-5 embryos.

label: nu neoblast
definition: A population of piwi-2+, ston-2+, elav-2+, ptprd-9+ and msi-1+ progenitors that give rise to one or more neuronal (pc-2+, synapsin+) lineages.

label: membrane part
definition: Any constituent part of a membrane, a double layer of lipid molecules that encloses all cells, and, in eukaryotes, many organelles; may be a single or double lipid bilayer; also includes associated proteins.

label: cell projection
definition: A prolongation or process extending from a cell.

label: blastema
definition: A regenerating tissue composed of a proliferative mass of undifferentiated progenitor cells from which new differentiated structures arise

label: obsolete organism subdivision
definition: OBSOLETE Anatomical structure which is a subdivision of a whole organism, consisting of components of multiple anatomical systems, largely surrounded by a contiguous region of integument.

label: tuba lumen
definition: Anatomical space enclosed by tuba. Oocyte(s) are fertilized in the tuba lumen by sperm that traveled up the oviduct.

label: inner pharyngeal circular muscle fiber
definition: Pharynx muscle fiber that runs circumferentially about the pharynx and lies just beneath the inner logitudinal pharynx muscle fibers.

label: primtive gut cell surface
definition: The surface of the primitive gut cells in contact with the embryonic wall.

label: obsolete regenerating anatomical structure
definition: OBSOLETE An anatomical structure that is undergoing regeneration.

label: obsolete anatomical plane
definition: OBSOLETE A flat anatomical 2D surface that bisects an anatomical structure or an anatomical space.

label: lumen gut surface
definition: The surface of the gut lumen in contact with ingested food.

label: reproductive system product
definition: Products of the reproductive system include gametes, zygotes, yolk cells and egg capsules.

label: anatomical compartment subdivision feature
definition: Feature of an organism that is a subdivision of a local region. For example, the anterior pole is a subdivision of the head.

label: vitelline gland
definition: Glands surrounding the oviducts which produce yolk cells. Yolk cells deposited into the oviducts travel to the genital atrium where they are packaged, along with one or more zygotes, into developing egg capsules.

label: sensory system
definition: Anatomical system that overlaps the nervous system and is responsible for receiving and processing sensory information.

label: rhabdite
definition: Straight or curved rod-like structures within the epidermal cells, oriented with long axis at right angles to the epidermal surface, that are discharged into mucous secretions.

label: zygote
definition:
Diploid cell resulting from the fusion of male and female gametes at fertilization. [ The_Dictionary_of_Cell_and_Molecular_Biology:Third_Edition ]

Diploid cell produced by the fusion of sperm cell nucleus and egg cell.

label: muscle progenitor
definition: Progenitor neoblasts implicated in the maintenance and regeneration of muscle fibers.

label: electrically responsive cell
definition: A cell whose function is determined by its response to an electric signal.

label: ectolecithal embryo
definition: Turbellarian (freshwater flatworm) embryos that undergo a modified form of cleavage due to separation of oocyte and yolk. Yolk is not contained within oocytes, and is produced by somatic vitellogenic gland cells.

label: transverse commissure
definition: Axon tracts from ganglia that cross the midline, connecting the two ventral nerve cords.

label: progenitor cell
definition: A cycling neoblast and/or post-mitotic cell that is primed or irreversibly committed to a tissue-specific differentation program

label: intracellular organelle
definition: Organized structure of distinctive morphology and function, occurring within the cell. Includes the nucleus, mitochondria, plastids, vacuoles, vesicles, ribosomes and the cytoskeleton. Excludes the plasma membrane.

label: Category 3 cell
definition: Post-mitotic, mesenchymally located epidermal progenitors downstream of the Category 2 cells.

label: tertiary gut branch
definition: Gut branches originating from and connected to the secondary gut branches.

label: zeta neoblast
definition: An abundant neoblast subclass consisting of p53+, zfp1+ progenitors required for maintenance and regeneration of epidermal cell type(s).

label: anterior compartment
definition: Compartment along the anteroposterior axis closer to the head rather than the tail, from the head margin to the esophagus.

label: mouth
definition: The sole point of entry and exit for the Triclad planarian flatworm gut. The mouth is connected to the pharyngeal pouch to allow for exit and re-entry of the definitive pharynx on the ventral side of the animal. The mouth contains several cell types, including epithelial cells, muscle, and secretory cells.

label: chromatin
definition: The ordered and organized complex of DNA, protein (histones), and sometimes RNA, that forms the chromosome.

label: direct development
definition: Embryonic development producing juvenile animals with body plans and feeding behavior similar to adults. Juveniles grow and mature into adults without undergoing metamorphosis.

label: TrpA+ central nervous system neuron
definition: A subset of TrpA+ neurons, located medially in the cephalic ganglia, whose formation is dependent on function of runt-1 and ap2.

label: cytoplasmic part
definition: Any constituent part of the cytoplasm, all of the contents of a cell excluding the plasma membrane and nucleus, but including other subcellular structures.

label: midline
definition: The median line/ plane of bilateral symmetry along the anteroposterior axis.

label: musculature system
definition: Total musculature of the planarian body.

label: secretory pore
definition: The opening by which the gland cells secrete mucus to the exterior of the animal.

label: pharnygeal pouch cavity
definition: Anatomical space between the definitive pharynx and the epithelial cells comprising parapharyngeal pouch.

label: interneuron
definition: Most generally any neuron which is not motor or sensory. Interneurons may also refer to neurons whose axons remain within a particular brain region as contrasted with projection neurons which have axons projecting to other brain regions.

label: pharynx nerve plexus
definition: Plexus of nerves located in the definitive pharynx comprised of inner and outer wall rings.

label: asexual adult
definition: The asexually reproducing Schmidtea mediterranea biotype exists as a constitutive adult, undergoing successive cycles of fission and whole animal regeneration. Asexual Schmidtea mediterranea contain primordial germ cells, but do not possess a reproductive system.

label: embryonic subdivision
definition: Anatomical structure which is a subdivision of a whole developing/ embryonic organism, consisting of components of multiple anatomical systems.

label: serotonergic neuron
definition: Neurons that express the neurotransmitter serotonin.

label: obsolete anatomical point
definition: OBSOLETE Non-material anatomical entity of zero dimension, which forms a boundary of an anatomical line or surface.

label: temporary embryonic pharynx radial muscle cell
definition: Differentiated radial muscle cell present in the temporary embryonic pharynx.

label: anterior commissure
definition: A bundle of nerve fibers connecting the two cephalic ganglia.

label: dextro-sinister axis of the whole animal
definition: Axis perpendicular to both the anteroposterior and dorsoventral axis that runs from the left side of the animal, through the medial region (center) and out to the right side.

label: dorsal region of the whole animal
definition: Three dimensional compartment along the dorsoventral axis that is above the anteroposterior axis,  containing the eyes.

label: anterior-posterior axis of the whole animal
definition: Axis that runs along the long axis of the animal from anterior (head) to posterior (tail). It is perpendicular to the dorsoventral axis and as such, it splits dorsal and ventral regions of the animal to either side.

label: dorsal-ventral axis of the whole animal
definition: Axis that runs along the short axis of the animal, perpendicular to the anteroposterior axis, running from the dorsal (back) side of the animal to the ventral (belly) side of the animal. This axis splits anterior and posterior regions of the animal to either side.

label: anterior region of the whole animal
definition: Compartment along the anteroposterior axis closer to the head rather than the tail, from the head margin to the esophagus.

label: ventral midline
definition: The median line/ plane of bilateral symmetry along the anteroposterior axis on the ventral surface of the animal.

label: apical surface of the epidermal compartment
definition: The apical surface of the single layered epidermis that is in contact with the environment.

label: dorsal midline
definition: The median line/plane of bilateral symmetry along the anteroposterior axis on the dorsal surface of the animal.

label: basal surface of the epidermal compartment
definition: The basal surface of the epidermal epithelium in direct contact with the basal lamina.

label: sagittal plane of the whole animal
definition: Anatomical plane which divides the body into right and left parts. This plane passes through the midline.

label: proximal-distal axis of the whole animal
definition: Axis that starts at the distal part of an appendage, closest to the body, and runs to the proximal part of an appendage, farthest from the body.

label: ventral compartment of the whole animal
definition: Compartment along the dorsoventral axis that is below the anteroposterior axis.

label: dorsal ventral margin
definition: Region along the edge of the animal where the dorsal and ventral surfaces meet.

label: oral-aboral axis of the embryo
definition: Axis that runs from the oral pole and to the aboral pole of the spherical embryo (Stage 3 through early Stage 6). The oral pole is centered around the temporary embryonic pharynx; the aboral pole is located opposite the temporary embryonic pharynx.

label: medial-lateral axis of the whole animal
definition: Axis that runs from the center of the body, starting at the anteroposterior axis and out to the lateral (left, right, dorsal or ventral) surface of the animal.

label: posterior compartment of the whole animal
definition: Three dimensional compartment along the anteroposterior axis that is closer to the tail rather than the head, from the anterior boundary of the pharyngeal pouch to the tip of the tail.

label: ventral region of the epidermal compartment
definition: Single cell layer of ventral, post-mitotic, heavily ciliated epithelial cells
